Public MustInherit Class ObservableValidator Inherits ObservableObject Implements INotifyDataErrorInfo
type ObservableValidator = class inherit ObservableObject interface INotifyDataErrorInfo

Docs.summary: A base class for objects implementing the interface. This class also inherits from , so it can be used for observable items too.

MemberSignature.Value: protected ObservableValidator (System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext validationContext);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext validationContext) cil managed

new Microsoft.Toolkit.Mvvm.ComponentModel.ObservableValidator : System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext -> Microsoft.Toolkit.Mvvm.ComponentModel.ObservableValidator

Docs.param:
The instance to use to validate properties.
This instance will be passed to all calls executed by the current viewmodel, and its property will be updated every time before the call is made to set the name of the property being validated. The property name will not be reset after that, so the value of will always indicate the name of the last property that was validated, if any.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor will store the input instance, and it will use it to validate all properties for the current viewmodel.

override this.SetProperty : 'T * 'T * bool * string -> bool

Docs.typeparam: The type of the property that changed.
Docs.param: The field storing the property's value.
The property's value after the change occurred.
If , will also be validated.
(optional) The name of the property that changed.
Docs.summary: Compares the current and new values for a given property. If the value has changed, raises the event, updates the property with the new value, then raises the event.
Docs.returns: if the property was changed, otherwise.
Docs.remarks: This method is just like , just with the addition of the parameter. If that is set to , the new value will be validated and will be raised if needed. Following the behavior of the base method, the and events are not raised if the current and new value for the target property are the same.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void ValidateAllProperties ();
.method familyhidebysig instance void ValidateAllProperties() cil managed
Protected Sub ValidateAllProperties ()
member this.ValidateAllProperties : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Validates all the properties in the current instance and updates all the tracked errors. If any changes are detected, the event will be raised.
Docs.remarks: Only public instance properties (excluding custom indexers) that have at least one applied to them will be validated. All other members in the current instance will be ignored. None of the processed properties will be modified - they will only be used to retrieve their values and validate them.
